message.content: The generated code currently does not have any form of password encryption for the users. Storing passwords in plain text is a security risk. A suggestion to improve this would be to hash the passwords before storing them in the 'users' dictionary. This way, even if someone gains access to the data, they won't be able to see the actual passwords.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The current code does not handle the case where a user tries to sign up with an email that is already in use. A suggestion to improve this would be to add a check in the signup function to see if the email is already in use. If it is, the function should return an appropriate error message.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The current code does not handle the case where a user tries to login or logout without being signed up first. A suggestion to improve this would be to add a check in the login and logout functions to see if the email exists in the users dictionary. If it does not, the function should return an appropriate error message.
